Others were taught by Wu's Friend who was not a UChicago faculty or have any relations to the school, which was illegal and she kept hidden from the math department. She was also a terrible lecturer.

Not a bad teacher. However, very tough grader; lab reports are extremely strict on points and it's the hardest class I've tried to get a 4.0 in so far. You need to talk to him and attend office hours to be successful. However, he's kind and helps you out, so not terrible.

Prof Pitcher was a good math teacher. Her lectures were clear and easy to understand, and her problem sets matched the material. The tests were a good difficulty, and I felt both challenged and inspired to learn.

Took Drugs Guns & Money with him -- amazing class (one of the best at UofC).  Interesting course material, and his lectures definitely did it justice. He assigns a lot of reading, but its 100% worth it. You'll learn a lot. I'd take a class with him again in a heartbeat.

Tom is one of the most brilliant minds in film theory.  His classes on Hitchcock, Horror, and the Avant-Garde were not to be missed when I was at school with him.  His lectures were so loved by students that people would sit in on them whether they were taking the course or not. Truly a brilliant man and filled with a sheer love for film.

Amazing professor. Changed my life!
She is brilliant. She has opened my eyes to new models of economic thinking. I learn a lot from her. I am very glad to be taking her class.

John List is so chill I can't even begin to describe it. Dude is funnier than the rest of the professors here all combined. Like you should literally go out of your way to try to take his class when he actually teaches a class besides just research

Introduction to Comparative Politics at uchicago is split between Nalepa and Albertus. Nalepa is a nightmare, Albertus makes up for it for sure. Offers extra credit, incredibly extensive slides(lecture recordings online)

Lots of material to cover in 9 weeks. I feel like he skipped some basics, and went too into detail in other parts. His tests are based on lecture examples and on problem sets (which on average took 6-8hrs/week). His office hours sadly clashed with all my other classes.
